metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Get Date Methods
The new Date() Constructor
In JavaScript, date objects are created with new Date() .
content.html: In JavaScript, date objects are created with new Date().

content.text: new Date() returns a date object with the current date and time.
content.html: new Date() returns a date object with the current date and time.

content.code_html: const date = new Date();

content.text: Date Get Methods

content.code_html:
Method Description
getFullYear() Get year as a four digit number (yyyy)
getMonth() Get month as a number (0-11)
getDate() Get day as a number (1-31)
getDay() Get weekday as a number (0-6)
getHours() Get hour (0-23)
getMinutes() Get minute (0-59)
getSeconds() Get second (0-59)
getMilliseconds() Get millisecond (0-999)
getTime() Get time (milliseconds since January 1, 1970)

content.text: Note 1
The get methods above return Local time .
content.html: The get methods above return Local time.

content.text: Universal time (UTC) is documented at the bottom of this page.
content.html: Universal time (UTC) is documented at the bottom of this page.

content.text: Note 2
The get methods return information from existing date objects.
content.html: The get methods return information from existing date objects.

content.text: In a date object, the time is static. The "clock" is not "running".
content.html: In a date object, the time is static. The "clock" is not "running".

content.text: The time in a date object is NOT the same as current time.
content.html: The time in a date object is NOT the same as current time.

content.text: The getFullYear() Method
The getFullYear() method returns the year of a date as a four digit number:
content.html: The getFullYear() method returns the year of a date as a four digit number:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getFullYear();

content.text: Warning !
Old JavaScript code might use the non-standard method getYear().
content.html: Old JavaScript code might use the non-standard method getYear().

content.text: getYear() is supposed to return a 2-digit year.
content.html: getYear() is supposed to return a 2-digit year.

content.text: getYear() is deprecated. Do not use it!
content.html: getYear() is deprecated. Do not use it!

content.text: The getMonth() Method
The getMonth() method returns the month of a date as a number (0-11).
content.html: The getMonth() method returns the month of a date as a number (0-11).

content.text: Note
In JavaScript, January is month number 0, February is number 1, ...
content.html: In JavaScript, January is month number 0, February is number 1, ...

content.text: Finally, December is month number 11.
content.html: Finally, December is month number 11.

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getMonth();

content.text: Note
You can use an array of names to return the month as a name:
content.html: You can use an array of names to return the month as a name:

content.code_html:
const months = ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"];

const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
let month = months[d.getMonth()];

content.text: The getDate() Method
The getDate() method returns the day of a date as a number (1-31):
content.html: The getDate() method returns the day of a date as a number (1-31):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getDate();

content.text: The getHours() Method
The getHours() method returns the hours of a date as a number (0-23):
content.html: The getHours() method returns the hours of a date as a number (0-23):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getHours();

content.text: The getMinutes() Method
The getMinutes() method returns the minutes of a date as a number (0-59):
content.html: The getMinutes() method returns the minutes of a date as a number (0-59):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getMinutes();

content.text: The getSeconds() Method
The getSeconds() method returns the seconds of a date as a number (0-59):
content.html: The getSeconds() method returns the seconds of a date as a number (0-59):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getSeconds();

content.text: The getMilliseconds() Method
The getMilliseconds() method returns the milliseconds of a date as a number (0-999):
content.html: The getMilliseconds() method returns the milliseconds of a date as a number (0-999):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getMilliseconds();

content.text: The getDay() Method
The getDay() method returns the weekday of a date as a number (0-6).
content.html: The getDay() method returns the weekday of a date as a number (0-6).

content.text: Note
In JavaScript, the first day of the week (day 0) is Sunday.
content.html: In JavaScript, the first day of the week (day 0) is Sunday.

content.text: Some countries in the world consider the first day of the week to be Monday.
content.html: Some countries in the world consider the first day of the week to be Monday.

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
d.getDay();

content.text: Note
You can use an array of names, and getDay() to return weekday as a name:
content.html: You can use an array of names, and getDay() to return weekday as a name:

content.code_html:
const days = ["Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday"];

const d = new Date("2021-03-25");
let day = days[d.getDay()];

content.text: The getTime() Method
The getTime() method returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970:
content.html: The getTime() method returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("1970-01-01");
d.getTime();

content.text: The Date.now() Method
Date.now() returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970.
content.html: Date.now() returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970.

content.code_html: let ms = Date.now();

content.text: Date.now() is a static method of the Date object.
content.html: Date.now() is a static method of the Date object.

content.text: You cannot use it on a date object like myDate.now() .
content.html: You cannot use it on a date object like myDate.now().

content.text: The syntax is always Date.now() .
content.html: The syntax is always Date.now().

content.text: UTC Date Get Methods

content.code_html:
Method Same As Description
getUTCDate() getDate()Returns the UTC date
getUTCFullYear() getFullYear()Returns the UTC year
getUTCMonth() getMonth()Returns the UTC month
getUTCDay() getDay()Returns the UTC day
getUTCHours() getHours()Returns the UTC hour
getUTCMinutes() getMinutes()Returns the UTC minutes
getUTCSeconds() getSeconds()Returns the UTC seconds
getUTCMilliseconds() getMilliseconds()Returns the UTC milliseconds

content.text: UTC methods use UTC time (Coordinated Universal Time).
content.html: UTC methods use UTC time (Coordinated Universal Time).

content.text: UTC time is the same as GMT (Greenwich Mean Time).
content.html: UTC time is the same as GMT (Greenwich Mean Time).

content.text: The difference between Local time and UTC time can be up to 24 hours.
content.html: The difference between Local time and UTC time can be up to 24 hours.

content.text: The getTimezoneOffset() Method
The getTimezoneOffset() method returns the difference (in minutes) between local time an UTC time:
content.html: The getTimezoneOffset() method returns the difference (in minutes) between local time an UTC time:

content.code_html: let diff = d.getTimezoneOffset();

content.text: Complete JavaScript Date Reference
For a complete Date reference, go to our:
content.html: For a complete Date reference, go to our:

content.text: Complete JavaScript Date Reference .
content.html: Complete JavaScript Date Reference.

content.text: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Date properties and methods.
content.html: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Date properties and methods.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the return value of the getDay() ?
content.html: What is the return value of the getDay()?
